divs: sighting detailsas i was taking teenage son's friend home. i noticed a rather bright amber light in the nne sky over holland, mi. the observation was made on 32nd street & washington, one block e from washington. the light\sphere was from that location coming across the sky at a different elevation or relationship to the horizon than a plane would typically follow. it was pronouncely different. at fist notice, it was far away (like over the north side of town or holland heights) and tracking to the ssw. i stopped vehicle in center lane on 32nd across from auto zone turned on hazard lights and got out & watched it track arcoss the sky. i looked at clock in my vehicle & it was minutes before midnight. the amber sphere\light moved very quickly but seemed to be moving purposefully. it appeared very, very high in the sky. it went overhead at a very high altitude. it did not waver from course. there were no flashing lights like one sees on an airplane. it was in sight for about 4 minutes. i checked to see if a satellite or iss was overhead -i cud not find anything that was passing overhead at my lat\long. i've seen the iss overhead before -this seemed different. the teenager who was with me observed the same. it was a clear night & the moon was out (1\2 moon was in view) i wud like to know what that was, especially if it was clearly not a satellite.
Summary: Bright light/sphere traveling from NNE to SSW
trends: There have been 20 other sightings in Holland
There were no other sightings in Holland on or around July 27th 2012
